title: Pilot
description: When they're forced to vacate their apartment, Kip and Henry don dresses to sneak into a women's hotel where their friend Amy lives.

title: My Brother, My Sister, Myself
description: The new hotel manager catches Kip in his underwear, so Amy concocts a story about Buffy and Hildy's brothers, Kip and Henry.

title: Loathe Thy Neighbor
description: Feuds erupt amongst Amy and Sonny and Kip and Henry.

title: Macho Man
description: Henry worries that people don't perceive him to be masculine, so he overcompensates.

title: What Price Glory?
description: The boys try to out-sleaze a rival ad man to land an account. Meanwhile Isabelle leads a self-defense class.

title: Kip and Sonny's Date
description: Sonny and a nervous Kip double-date with Henry and Ruth's purple-haired niece who calls herself Andrea Puss.

title: Beauty and the Beasts
description: Kip and Henry get a lesson in sexism when their alter-egos are dragged to a singles bar, so Henry asks out Amy.

title: Revenge
description: Amy instigates an elaborate charade with her friends to get back at a snobby congressional aide who dumped her at a costume party.

title: Amy's Career
description: Amy employs unusual tactics when she pitches an ad for Mountain Pine mouthwash.

title: Gotta Dance
description: Sonny decides to go home to Michigan, so Kip entices her to stay by getting her a starring role in a TV commercial.

title: Sonny Boy
description: After stopping a robbery while dressed as Buffy & Hildegarde, Kip & Henry (still in drag) end up on the TV news. Unfortunately their appearance prompts a visit from Henry's mother, who's now worried about her son.

title: How Great Thou Art
description: Kip's artwork inspires Henry to have it displayed in a special showing inside a local art gallery as an original birthday present for him. Some attending patrons though , are not impressed with it.

title: Kip Quits
description: Kip quits his job and winds up selling hot dogs on a street corner.

title: Only the Lonely
description: When Ruth pushes an evening of home entertainment on Kip and Henry, they realize she may not have any friends. Meanwhile Sonny, Amy and Isabelle care for a box full of kittens.

title: The Rewrite
description: Buffy and Hildy are nearly unmasked, so Henry writes about the incident and keeps trying to improve the story by changing the tone.

title: The Show Must Go On
description: The guys take jobs bussing tables to afford Isabelle the opportunity to sing in a night club.

title: The Hospital
description: A blind hospital patient who can see right through Kip falls for Sonny. Meanwhile Lily is hospitalized for mono and Buffy and Hildy work at the hospital as candy stripers.

title: Best Friends
description: Henry gets left in the dust when Kip reconnects with an old friend who's become a rock star.

title: Cahoots
description: Kip tries to hook Amy up with Henry; Amy tries to hook up Sonny with Kip.

title: The Truth and Other Lies
description: Kip's ill-timed decision to tell Sonny the truth about his alter-ego causes an international incident.

title: There's No Business...
description: Henry impulsively buys a TV commercial production house and later learns it's heavily in debt.

title: Reunion
description: At their class reunion, Henry relives a painful incident with a deaf girl while Kip tries to flaunt Sonny in front of all of his former classmates.

title: One for You, One for Me
description: Their first business meeting, related to their production company "60 seconds", leads Henry to make the decision to put a cap or limit on Kip's footloose and fancy free spending habits.

title: On the Road to Monte Carlo
description: Kip and Henry are nearly crushed in an elevator accident and subsequently decide to experience some wild fantasies before they die.

title: WaterBalloonGate
description: After unknowingly pelting Richard Nixon's car with a water-balloon, Kip decides it's time to grow up.

title: All You Need Is Love
description: Henry signs up with a video dating service; Kip tries to lure Sonny into bed.

title: Other Than That, She's a Wonderful Person
description: Tension is high amongst everyone when Henry begins dating the interior designer Ruth hired.

title: The Slightly Illustrated Man
description: Sonny catches Kip kissing another woman, so he tries to prove his commitment to their relationship by getting a tattoo.

title: Two Percent Solution
description: Ruth quits her job and comes to work full time at 60 Seconds Street. When feuds erupt between Ruth and the boys, Amy realizes her stake in the company is significant.

title: Cablevision
description: Kip & Henry and their friends put together a cable TV show, to help keep a client and advertise his business. As well as promising him celebrity guest Penny Marshall.

title: The Grandfather
description: Henry saves the life of a mobster's granddaughter.

title: Kip Off the Old Block
description: Kip's parents visit the Big Apple and their marriage falls apart.

title: Hildy's Dirt Nap
description: When an immigrant sets his sights on Hildy, Henry decides to fake her death. Meanwhile, Isabelle tries to land an agent.

title: The Way Kip and Henry Were
description: To cheer up Isabelle, Henry recounts his college days and the story of how the boys began working for Ruth.

title: Who's on Thirst?
description: Kip and Henry's weekend at a secluded cabin yields hunger and fears of death. Meanwhile Ruth accidentally lets a tiger loose in New York City.

title: Not with My Sister, You Pig
description: After Henry is asked to take out Kip's sister, Kip and Henry wind up in a fight that lands them both in the hospital.

title: Not the Last Picture Show
description: After the gang has a terrible time at a new wave concert, Kip daydreams about what life will be like for them as they get old.
